section.title: Programming Model Overview
section.para: The security programming model differs between the client and server side. The client side model is programmatic in nature, i.e. security related code is driven by making actual function calls, whereas the server side model is declarative, i.e. security related settings are declared in a security descriptor. For more information on the available client side calls see . More information about the security descriptor can be found in .
